title: Byzantine Emperor Zeno is forced to flee his capital at Constantinople, and his general, Basiliscus gains control of the empire.
text: Byzantine Emperor Zeno is forced to flee his capital at Constantinople, and his general, Basiliscus gains control of the empire.

title: Twelfth Council of Toledo: King Erwig of the Visigoths initiates a council in which he implements diverse measures against the Jews in Spain.
text: Twelfth Council of Toledo: King Erwig of the Visigoths initiates a council in which he implements diverse measures against the Jews in Spain.

title: Jin–Song Wars: Invading Jurchen soldiers from the Jin dynasty besiege and sack Bianjing (Kaifeng), the capital of the Song dynasty of China, and abduct Emperor Qinzong of Song and others, ending the Northern Song dynasty.
text: Jin–Song Wars: Invading Jurchen soldiers from the Jin dynasty besiege and sack Bianjing (Kaifeng), the capital of the Song dynasty of China, and abduct Emperor Qinzong of Song and others, ending the Northern Song dynasty.

title: Wanyan Liang and other court officials murder Emperor Xizong of Jin. Wanyan Liang succeeds him as emperor.
text: Wanyan Liang and other court officials murder Emperor Xizong of Jin. Wanyan Liang succeeds him as emperor.

title: The Jewish population of Basel, believed by the residents to be the cause of the ongoing Black Death, is rounded up and incinerated.
text: The Jewish population of Basel, believed by the residents to be the cause of the ongoing Black Death, is rounded up and incinerated.

title: Judges' investigations for the trial of Joan of Arc begin in Rouen.
text: Judges' investigations for the trial of Joan of Arc begin in Rouen.

title: Ahmad Shah Durrani defeats the Marathas in the Battle of Barari Ghat.
text: Ahmad Shah Durrani defeats the Marathas in the Battle of Barari Ghat.

title: Connecticut becomes the fifth state to ratify the Constitution.
text: Connecticut becomes the fifth state to ratify the Constitution.

title: Treaty of Jassy between Russian and Ottoman Empire is signed.
text: Treaty of Jassy between Russian and Ottoman Empire is signed.

title: Jean-Pierre Blanchard becomes the first person to fly in a balloon in the United States.
text: Jean-Pierre Blanchard becomes the first person to fly in a balloon in the United States.

title: British Prime Minister William Pitt the Younger introduces an income tax of two shillings to the pound to raise funds for Great Britain's war effort in the Napoleonic Wars.
text: British Prime Minister William Pitt the Younger introduces an income tax of two shillings to the pound to raise funds for Great Britain's war effort in the Napoleonic Wars.

title: Admiral Horatio Lord Nelson receives a state funeral and is interred in St Paul's Cathedral.
text: Admiral Horatio Lord Nelson receives a state funeral and is interred in St Paul's Cathedral.

title: Sir Humphry Davy tests his safety lamp for miners at Hebburn Colliery.
text: Sir Humphry Davy tests his safety lamp for miners at Hebburn Colliery.

title: The Portuguese prince Pedro I of Brazil decides to stay in Brazil against the orders of the Portuguese King João VI, beginning the Brazilian independence process.
text: The Portuguese prince Pedro I of Brazil decides to stay in Brazil against the orders of the Portuguese King João VI, beginning the Brazilian independence process.

title: The French Academy of Sciences announces the Daguerreotype photography process.
text: The French Academy of Sciences announces the Daguerreotype photography process.

title: The 7.9 Mw Fort Tejon earthquake shakes Central and Southern California with a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent).
text: The 7.9 Mw Fort Tejon earthquake shakes Central and Southern California with a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent).

title: Anson Jones, the last President of the Republic of Texas, commits suicide.
text: Anson Jones, the last President of the Republic of Texas, commits suicide.

title: American Civil War: "Star of the West" incident occurs near Charleston, South Carolina.
text: American Civil War: "Star of the West" incident occurs near Charleston, South Carolina.

title: Mississippi becomes the second state to secede from the Union before the outbreak of the American Civil War.
text: Mississippi becomes the second state to secede from the Union before the outbreak of the American Civil War.

title: Umberto I becomes King of Italy.
text: Umberto I becomes King of Italy.

title: New England Telephone and Telegraph installs the first battery-operated telephone switchboard in Lexington, Massachusetts.
text: New England Telephone and Telegraph installs the first battery-operated telephone switchboard in Lexington, Massachusetts.

title: Hallam Tennyson, 2nd Baron Tennyson, son of the poet Alfred Tennyson, becomes the second Governor-General of Australia.
text: Hallam Tennyson, 2nd Baron Tennyson, son of the poet Alfred Tennyson, becomes the second Governor-General of Australia.

title: Ernest Shackleton, leading the Nimrod Expedition to the South Pole, plants the British flag 97 nautical miles (180 km; 112 mi) from the South Pole, the farthest anyone had ever reached at that time.
text: Ernest Shackleton, leading the Nimrod Expedition to the South Pole, plants the British flag 97 nautical miles (180 km; 112 mi) from the South Pole, the farthest anyone had ever reached at that time.

title: Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity Inc., the first historically black intercollegiate Greek-letter fraternity to be officially recognized at Howard University, is founded.
text: Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity Inc., the first historically black intercollegiate Greek-letter fraternity to be officially recognized at Howard University, is founded.

title: World War I: The Battle of Gallipoli concludes with an Ottoman Empire victory when the last Allied forces are evacuated from the peninsula.
text: World War I: The Battle of Gallipoli concludes with an Ottoman Empire victory when the last Allied forces are evacuated from the peninsula.

title: World War I: The Battle of Rafa is fought near the Egyptian border with Palestine.
text: World War I: The Battle of Rafa is fought near the Egyptian border with Palestine.

title: Battle of Bear Valley: The last battle of the American Indian Wars.
text: Battle of Bear Valley: The last battle of the American Indian Wars.

title: Greco-Turkish War: The First Battle of İnönü, the first battle of the war, begins near Eskişehir in Anatolia.
text: Greco-Turkish War: The First Battle of İnönü, the first battle of the war, begins near Eskişehir in Anatolia.

title: Juan de la Cierva makes the first autogyro flight.
text: Juan de la Cierva makes the first autogyro flight.

title: Lithuanian residents of the Memel Territory rebel against the League of Nations' decision to leave the area as a mandated region under French control.
text: Lithuanian residents of the Memel Territory rebel against the League of Nations' decision to leave the area as a mandated region under French control.

title: A fire at the Laurier Palace movie theatre in Montreal, Quebec, Canada, kills 78 children.
text: A fire at the Laurier Palace movie theatre in Montreal, Quebec, Canada, kills 78 children.

title: World War II: First flight of the Avro Lancaster.
text: World War II: First flight of the Avro Lancaster.

title: World War II: The Sixth United States Army begins the invasion of Lingayen Gulf.
text: World War II: The Sixth United States Army begins the invasion of Lingayen Gulf.

title: British Prime Minister Sir Anthony Eden resigns from office following his failure to retake the Suez Canal from Egyptian sovereignty.
text: British Prime Minister Sir Anthony Eden resigns from office following his failure to retake the Suez Canal from Egyptian sovereignty.

title: President of Egypt Gamal Abdel Nasser opens construction on the Aswan Dam by detonating ten tons of dynamite to demolish twenty tons of granite on the east bank of the Nile.
text: President of Egypt Gamal Abdel Nasser opens construction on the Aswan Dam by detonating ten tons of dynamite to demolish twenty tons of granite on the east bank of the Nile.

title: Martyrs' Day: Several Panamanian youths try to raise the Panamanian flag in the U.S.-controlled Panama Canal Zone, leading to fighting between U.S. military and Panamanian civilians.
text: Martyrs' Day: Several Panamanian youths try to raise the Panamanian flag in the U.S.-controlled Panama Canal Zone, leading to fighting between U.S. military and Panamanian civilians.

title: The Mirzapur Cadet College formally opens for academic activities in East Pakistan (now Bangladesh).
text: The Mirzapur Cadet College formally opens for academic activities in East Pakistan (now Bangladesh).

title: Representatives from the United States and Iraq meet at the Geneva Peace Conference to try to find a peaceful resolution to the Iraqi invasion of Kuwait.
text: Representatives from the United States and Iraq meet at the Geneva Peace Conference to try to find a peaceful resolution to the Iraqi invasion of Kuwait.

title: The Assembly of the Serb People in Bosnia and Herzegovina proclaims the creation of Republika Srpska, a new state within Yugoslavia.
text: The Assembly of the Serb People in Bosnia and Herzegovina proclaims the creation of Republika Srpska, a new state within Yugoslavia.

title: The first discoveries of extrasolar planets are announced by astronomers Aleksander Wolszczan and Dale Frail. They discovered two planets orbiting the pulsar PSR 1257+12.[1]
text: The first discoveries of extrasolar planets are announced by astronomers Aleksander Wolszczan and Dale Frail. They discovered two planets orbiting the pulsar PSR 1257+12.[1]

title: First Chechen War: Chechen separatists launch a raid against the helicopter airfield and later a civilian hospital in the city of Kizlyar in the neighboring Dagestan, which turns into a massive hostage crisis involving thousands of civilians.
text: First Chechen War: Chechen separatists launch a raid against the helicopter airfield and later a civilian hospital in the city of Kizlyar in the neighboring Dagestan, which turns into a massive hostage crisis involving thousands of civilians.

title: An inflatable boat carrying illegal Albanian emigrants stalls near the Karaburun Peninsula en route to Brindisi, Italy; exposure to the elements kills 28. This is the second deadliest naval tragedy in Albanian history.
text: An inflatable boat carrying illegal Albanian emigrants stalls near the Karaburun Peninsula en route to Brindisi, Italy; exposure to the elements kills 28. This is the second deadliest naval tragedy in Albanian history.

title: Mahmoud Abbas wins the election to succeed Yasser Arafat as President of the Palestinian National Authority, replacing interim president Rawhi Fattouh.
text: Mahmoud Abbas wins the election to succeed Yasser Arafat as President of the Palestinian National Authority, replacing interim president Rawhi Fattouh.

title: The Sudan People's Liberation Movement and the Government of Sudan sign the Comprehensive Peace Agreement to end the Second Sudanese Civil War.

title: Apple CEO Steve Jobs introduces the original iPhone at a Macworld keynote in San Francisco.

title: Iran Air Flight 277 crashes near Orumiyeh in the northeast of the country, killing 77 people.

title: An explosion at a Mitsubishi Materials chemical plant in Yokkaichi, Japan, kills at least five people and injures 17 others.

title: The perpetrators of the Charlie Hebdo shooting in Paris two days earlier are both killed after a hostage situation; a second hostage situation, related to the Charlie Hebdo shooting, occurs at a Jewish market in Vincennes.
